questions.question: What is a camelopard also known as?
questions.description: The giraffe (Giraffa camelopardalis) is an African even-toed ungulate mammal, the tallest living terrestrial animal and the largest ruminant. Its species name refers to its camel-like appearance and the patches of color on its fur.

questions.question: Some animals always grow new teeth to replace the old ones. Name one of them!
questions.description: Sharks are a group of fish characterized by a cartilaginous skeleton, five to seven gill slits on the sides of the head, and pectoral fins that are not fused to the head.

questions.question: What animal can get the disease 'heaves'?
questions.description: The horse (Equus ferus caballus) is one of two extant subspecies of Equus ferus. It is an odd-toed ungulate mammal belonging to the taxonomic family Equidae.

questions.question: What animal can hop as fast as 40 mph?
questions.description: The horse (Equus ferus caballus) is one of two extant subspecies of Equus ferus. It is an odd-toed ungulate mammal belonging to the taxonomic family Equidae.

questions.question: What animal has red patches on its rear?
questions.description: The mandrill (Mandrillus sphinx) is a primate of the Old World monkey (Cercopithecidae) family,[4] closely related to the baboons and even more closely to the drill. It is found in southern Cameroon, Gabon, Equatorial Guinea, and Congo.

questions.question: What animal lives in a warren?
questions.description: Rabbits are small mammals in the family Leporidae of the order Lagomorpha, found in several parts of the world.

questions.question: What animal lives in a form?
questions.description: Hares and jackrabbits are leporids belonging to the genus Lepus. Hares are classified into the same family as rabbits and are of similar size, form, and diet as rabbits.
